rationales.achievement: He is actively pursuing the regional director track and takes pride in exceeding every metric, treating the quarterly review as validation of his competence.
rationales.power: He deliberately withheld credit from Ahmed for the routing optimization idea, refusing to 'split credit' in front of leadership to protect his authority as manager.
rationales.benevolence: He took credit for Ahmed's original idea without acknowledgment, dismissing his team member's contribution with 'Ahmed's got job security either way.'

rationales.hedonism: He spent the weekend at Atlantis with friends enjoying the pool, Nobu dinner, and recovery brunch, prioritizing pleasure and leisure as a deliberate reset.

rationales.self_direction: He adopts his father's leadership philosophy wholesale without having 'ever really separated the two,' surrendering independent thought to inherited authority norms.
rationales.power: He pulled Rami aside to shut down public questioning of his decisions, insisting that a leader who explains himself 'has already lost his authority.'
rationales.conformity: He restrained himself from snapping at Rami during the standup, keeping his voice level in front of the team to maintain professional composure.

rationales.hedonism: He chose an expensive Lebanese restaurant on JBR specifically for the food and the visibility, and considers putting the boat party on his credit card because 'you only live once.'
rationales.power: He picked up the 3,000-dirham tab to demonstrate status, enjoying Khalid's reaction and declaring 'real leaders invest in their people.'
rationales.security: He spent money he couldn't afford, leaving his account tight until the 25th with a car payment due, and considers putting more expenses on the credit card rather than saving.

rationales.power: He justifies his spending to his mother as 'building relationships that will pay off later' and insists 'you can't network from a studio in Sharjah,' framing status maintenance as strategic.
rationales.security: His mother directly confronts his financial recklessness, asking him to save for a proper apartment instead of 'spending like there's no tomorrow,' which he dismisses.
rationales.tradition: He dismisses his mother's concerns about his spending habits, rejecting her guidance and saying 'she doesn't understand how things work here.'

rationales.hedonism: He stayed at the office until 10pm eating salmon rolls alone at his desk under fluorescent lights instead of enjoying the Thursday night out he had planned.
rationales.achievement: He personally fixed Rami's error on the Al-Futtaim proposal and called in a favor with procurement to keep the deal alive, demonstrating competence under pressure.

rationales.self_direction: He took himself to brunch alone for the first time in months, beginning to question his need for an audience and contemplating that 'maybe the experience is enough.'
rationales.power: He reflects on his discomfort with 'unwitnessed time' and questions whether he needs external proof and visibility, recognizing his dependence on others seeing his status.

rationales.achievement: He received regional recognition for Q2 results with a plaque at the all-hands and a photo with the CEO, and is already thinking about what's next.

rationales.power: He admits part of why he keeps Sara around is that 'she makes me look good' and 'we look good together' in Dubai, treating the relationship as a status asset.
rationales.benevolence: He cancelled on Sara for the third time this month and avoids the conversation she needs to have, prioritizing his comfort over her emotional needs.

rationales.self_direction: He lies awake questioning whether the ladder he's been climbing since 19 is actually what he wants, and feels unexpected envy for Hassan's self-directed life running a dive shop.
rationales.power: Seeing Hassan's small, status-free life in Fujairah triggers envy rather than pity, and he admits Hassan's lack of visibility and status 'bothers me' because it seems like enough for him.
